person.persName: Oliver D. Greene (Assistant adjutant general of the United States of America)

body.p: New York soldier. New York native. Graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point in 1854. Served as captain of the 2nd United States Regular Artillery (Co. G). Served as a major, lieutenant colonel, and assistant adjutant general of the United States Volunteers under General Don Carlos Buell in 1861. Served as chief of staff of the VI Corps during the Battle of Antietam. Awarded the medal of honor on December 13, 1893 for his service at the Battle of Antietam on September 17, 1862. Transferred to the Regular U.S. Army and served the remainder of the war as assistant adjutant general in the Department of the Missouri until the end of the war.
